episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the tradition of Beefeaters receiving gin on their birthdays, the measurement of Roman economic activity through Greenland ice, the decorative use of umlauts in band names, and the unique Hawaiian tradition of genital chants.

facts.fact: On their birthday, every Beefeater at the Tower of London gets a gift of a free bottle of Beefeater gin.
The economic activity of the Roman Empire can be measured by studying thousand-year-old ice in Greenland.
The umlauts that are used for the band Motley Crue are purely decorative; however, when Motley Crue first performed in Germany, the crowd didn't know that and chanted, 'Motley Krug!'
Traditionally, indigenous Hawaiians had personalized chants for their genitals.
